1.name: General actions, making etc.
1.desc: General/abstract terms relating to an activity/action (e.g. act, adventure, approach, arise); a characteristic/feature (e.g. absorb, attacking, automatically); a construction/craft and/or the action of constructing/crafting (e.g. arrange, assemble, bolts, boring, break)

2.name: Damaging and destroying
2.desc: General/abstract terms depicting damage/destruction/demolition/pollution, etc

2.name: Suitability
2.desc: General/abstract terms relating to appropriateness, suitability, aptness, etc

3.name: Caution
3.desc: General/abstract terms relating to vigilance/care/prudence, or the lack of.

4.name: Chance, luck
4.desc: General/abstract terms depicting likelihood/probability/providence, or the lack of.

1.name: Using
1.desc: General/abstract terms denoting use, or the lack of

2.name: Usefulness
2.desc: General/abstract terms denoting usefulness, or the lack of

9.name: Avoiding
9.desc: General/abstract terms denoting (level of) avoidance/evasion, etc

1.name: Affect: Modify, change
1.desc: General/abstract terms denoting (propensity for) change

2.name: Affect: Cause/Connected
2.desc: General/abstract terms denoting causal relationship, or lack of

3.name: Being
3.desc: General/abstract terms relating to being/existing

1.name: Generally kinds, groups, examples
1.desc: General/abstract terms denoting types, groups, examples

2.name: Particular/general; detail
2.desc: General/abstract terms denoting (level of) generality/detail

1.name: Evaluation: Good/bad
1.desc: Evaluative terms depicting quality

2.name: Evaluation: True/false
2.desc: Evaluative terms depicting truth

3.name: Evaluation: Accuracy
3.desc: Evaluative terms depicting accuracy

1.name: Comparing: Similar/different
1.desc: Comparative terms denoting similarity/difference

2.name: Comparing: Usual/unusual
2.desc: Comparative terms denoting (level) of anomaly

3.name: Comparing: Variety
3.desc: Comparative terms denoting (level of) variety

7.name: Definite (+ modals)
7.desc: Abstract terms of modality (possibility, necessity, certainty, etc.)

10.name: Open/closed; Hiding/Hidden; Finding; Showing
10.desc: General/abstract terms relating to (level of) openness/concealment/exposure, etc

1.name: Importance: Important
1.desc: Abstract terms denoting importance/significance

2.name: Importance: Noticeability
2.desc: Abstract terms denoting noticeability/markedness

1.name: Degree: Non-specific
1.desc: Non-specific terms of degree (e.g. intensifiers)

2.name: Degree: Maximizers
2.desc: Intensifiers that amplify to the upper extreme

3.name: Degree: Boosters
3.desc: Intensifiers that amplify to a high degree (but not the upper extreme)

5.name: Degree: Compromisers
5.desc: Downtowners that express an assumed norm, or call into question the appropriacy of X

6.name: Degree: Diminishers
6.desc: Downtowners that express only part of the potential force of X, or seek to imply that the force of X is limited in some way (e.g. ‘to a small extent’)

7.name: Degree: Minimizers
7.desc: Downtowners that imply that the force of X is limited in a maximal way (e.g. ‘(not) to any extent’)

14.name: Exclusivizers/particularizers
14.desc: Focusing subjuncts that draw attention to/focus upon X. Includes exclusives and particularizers (see Quirk et al 1985: 604)

15.name: Safety/Danger
15.desc: Abstract terms relating to (the level) of safety/danger
